result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. KENNETH R. BLEVINS

records.addlTxt: 8:47 AM Defendant KENNETH R. BLEVINS not in court.  Attorney Nicole A Morley in court for KENNETH R. BLEVINS.  Attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for State of Wisconsin.  DE doesn't appear, no explanation. The State notes the DE has not set up the 24/7 program yet.  Bench Warrant Authorized.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.
Allow 48 business hours for processing.  $35 warrant fee.

11:09 AM Defendant KENNETH R. BLEVINS not in court.  Attorney Nicole A Morley in court for KENNETH R. BLEVINS.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Jeanne Struve in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE doesn't appear, per Vine Link and the Outagamie County Jail roster, the DE is no longer in custody.  Attorney Morley requests another date.  The State notes the DE has not signed up for the Drug 24/7 program.  The Court will set another PTC. Bond Continues. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: unsigned Bail/Bond form returned from WCJ - DE refused to sign on 05-12-2022

POSS OF METH, BAIL JUMP
CONDITIONS:   Absolute sobriety.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.

02:30 PM Defendant KENNETH R. BLEVINS in court with attorney Morgan Rae.  Defendant KENNETH R. BLEVINS in custody.  Anthony Prekop appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KENNETH R. BLEVINS appeared by video means with Attorney.  Given/has complaint. Waive reading.  The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 2:33.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
